job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-07-14T16:58:51.000Z", "description": "

Software Developer


Paragon Hire has an opening with our client for a full-time direct hire REMOTE Software Developer reporting to the Development Manager. 

 

The Software Developer is responsible for using coding languages to compose, compile and test programs and applications in order to provide cellular cost optimization services to enterprises. The Software Developer will join our talented A-team with a shared commitment to reduce our clients\u2019 monthly cell phone bills while simultaneously making it easier to manage their mobile device inventory and services. 

 

Our client, headquartered in New York, has been helping businesses around the world better manage their corporate-liable mobility assets for over 10 years with advanced mobile device management solutions and services. Through a mix of technology, processes, and people they scrutinize every element a Customer\u2019s corporate mobility environment optimize your costs, increase your efficiency and provide you with real-time visibility and control. 

 

Responsibilities

 

\u00b7      Collaborate with project manager, clients, end users, and other stakeholders to understand user needs.

\u00b7      Shape our product and deliver new features monthly improving our effectiveness and making our users happier. 

\u00b7      Attend and contribute to development team meeting.

\u00b7      Build new applications that will increase the values. 

\u00b7      Analyzes existing program logic to identify causes of program malfunctions; modifies program logic to eliminate problems or increase the operational efficiency of the program.

\u00b7      Maintains knowledge of trends and developments in related areas of technology and programming.

\u00b7      You will work under the tutelage of our team lead and developer extraordinaire, and alongside other like-minded professionals to design systems to support applications.

\u00b7      Write and maintain code.

\u00b7      Work on bug fixes.

\u00b7      Performs other related duties as assigned.

 

Required Skills

 

\u00b7      Able to write excellent code to solve complex business problems and process automation.

\u00b7      You are eager to learn but have a solid foundation of experience to bring to the team. 

\u00b7      Thorough understanding of design, testing, and modification of programs and applications.

\u00b7      Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn the technologies, coding and programming languages used in the organization.

\u00b7      Knowledge of coding languages and systems.

\u00b7      Able to develop front end UX using CSS3, HTML5 and Bootstrap while delivering content from MSSQL via Ruby on Rails. 

\u00b7      Eager to create new integrations with other systems to enhance our capabilities and find new ways to leverage existing features. 

\u00b7      Strong problem-solving, analytical and communication skills.

\u00b7      Excellent time management skills.

\u00b7      Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and related software.  

\u00b7      Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

 

Experience and Education

 

\u00b7      Three years of related work experience required. 

\u00b7      Bachelor\u2019s degree or technical certification required.

 

Our Client Provides

 

\u00b7      Location: You have the option of working in one of our two offices (Long Island, NY or East Windsor, NJ) alongside other team members, 100% remote in the comfort of your most effective environment, or a hybrid of the two based on your location. 

\u00b7      Salary & benefits to commensurate with experience and achievement.

\u00b7      Training opportunities and a highly collaborative environment.
